Create an account for the website the webinar is through
Submit a certificate of completion for each online webinar for paySubmit

TOMORROW, NOVEMBER 6TH:

Attention senior Bearcat parents and guardians:

Do you want to help your child afford college? Then come by the "Free Money: Paying for College" FAFSA completion workshop at Battle Creek Central this Wednesday, Nov 6th, 5-7 PM. Pizza will be provided! There will be professional assistance to help you complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid, better known as the FAFSA, in order for your senior to receive any financial aid for college. You will need your and (your student's) Social Security Number or Alien Registration Number, completed 2018 Tax Return Form, Driver's License, and 2018 W-2 Form. You can also share the tax info with your student, and they can complete the application for you. Hope to see you there! Any questions or concerns can be directed to Breanna Gilland, college adviser, bgilland@battle-creek.k12.mi.us.

Good morning Bearcat community,

Out of an abundance of caution in response to statewide and local recommendations, and due to a recently confirmed case of Eastern Equine Encephalitis (EEE) in Calhoun County, all twelve superintendents in the Calhoun Intermediate School District (CISD) have agreed to make schedule changes for outdoor activities, to the extent possible, to reduce exposure to EEE.

To provide time to honor and celebrate our homecoming court, the homecoming parade has been moved to an earlier time and will include an alternate route. The parade will take place on the track in C.W. Post Stadium. Line up will begin at 4:00 p.m. and the parade will step off at 4:30 p.m. in preparation for the football game kickoff at 5:30 p.m.

We are hopeful that this adjustment will still allow our students to experience the excitement of homecoming festivities while also adhering to public health recommendations. Although sports and outdoor activities are an important part of a child’s education, nothing is more important than their health and safety.

post_text: It was so much fun being able to join Los Hermanos de Café Rica on their most recent podcast. The 2019-20 school year starts tomorrow, and we have so much to look forward to for the coming year! Take a listen to learn more about the great things happening at BCPS. Thanks to Jackson and Tristan for your passion for Downtown Battle Creek and those living in our community!

Café Rica
August 20, 2019 at 6:07 AM ·

Out now on all listening platforms under “The Los Hermanos Podcast” and will be out on video later today!

This was a very interesting round table discussion about how changes in the Battle Creek Public School system is underway and how they will affect the children of today and the community of tomorrow.

We do apologize about the audio cutting out early but most of the interview was captured. Enjoy!

We can't wait to see how our BCCHS students will shape the future of our city!
